title: Neuro-Modeling Infused EMT Analytics
authors: Qing Shen; Yifan Zhou; Peng Zhang; Yacov A. Shamash; Xiaochuan Luo; Bin Wang; Huanfeng Zhao; Roshan Sharma; Bo Chen
notes: arXiv:2406.17661v1; proposes Physics-Informed neuro-Models (PIM) for EMT-oriented transient grid analytics with hybrid data-physics learning and balanced-adaptive loss; validated on induction machine and grid-forming inverter plus IEEE 39-bus study (Secs. II–IV).

title: Physics-Informed Multi-Agent deep reinforcement learning enabled distributed voltage control for active distribution network using PV inverters
authors: Bin Zhang; Di Cao; Weihao Hu; Amer M.Y.M. Ghias; Zhe Chen
venue: International Journal of Electrical Power & Energy Systems
notes: Proposes GT-MADDPG: physics-informed/physics-guided multi-agent DRL (GNN + Transformer + PGA-LSTM) for distributed Volt/VAR control via PV inverter reactive power, with centralized training and distributed execution; evaluated on modified IEEE 33-bus and IEEE 141-bus distribution networks using PandaPower time-series power flow; includes robustness tests for uncertainty and communication failures (Secs. 3–4; Tables 2–3; Figs. 6–14).

title: Artificial intelligence for microgrids design, control, and maintenance: A comprehensive review and prospects
authors: Mojtaba Hadi; Elhoussin Elbouchikhi; Zhibin Zhou; Abdelhakim Saim; Miadreza Shafie-khah; Pierluigi Siano; Hesam Rahbarimagham; Pau Marti Colom
notes: Open-access review paper covering AI for microgrid design/sizing, hierarchical control (primary/secondary/tertiary/EMS), and maintenance (PQD/fault diagnosis). Mentions operational mode transitions between grid-connected and islanded modes conceptually (Sec. 2.1) and surveys AI for operational mode detection (Table 4), but does not present original transition-phase experiments or quantitative transition outcomes.

title: State-of-the-art review on energy and load forecasting in microgrids using artificial neural networks, machine learning, and deep learning techniques
authors: Raniyah Wazirali; Elnaz Yaghoubi; Mohammed Shadi S. Abujazar; Rami Ahmad; Amir Hossein Vakili
notes: Review of ANN/ML/DL methods for load demand and renewable energy (PV/wind) forecasting in microgrids across ultra-short/short/medium/long horizons; comparisons summarized in Tables 5–13; overview trends in Fig. 3; no original operational transition/control evaluation reported.

title: Physics-informed graphical neural network for power system state estimation
authors: Quang-Ha Ngo; Bang L.H. Nguyen; Tuyen V. Vu; Jianhua Zhang; Tuan Ngo
notes: Proposes a physics-informed graphical learning method for dynamic power system state estimation (voltage magnitude and phase angle) using branch-current physics + GNN; evaluated on IEEE 5-bus, IEEE 123-bus, and IEEE 8500-bus under load-change scenarios; see Secs. 3–4 and Table 4.

title: Optimizing energy management of smart grid using reinforcement learning aided by surrogate models built using physics-informed neural networks
authors: Julen Cestero; Carmine Delle Femine; Kenji S. Muro; Marco Quartulli; Marcello Restelli
notes: Smart grid active network management via reinforcement learning aided by a PINN-based surrogate model.

title: Physics-Informed Multi-Agent deep reinforcement learning enabled distributed voltage control for active distribution network using PV inverters
authors: Bin Zhang; Di Cao; Weihao Hu; Amer M.Y.M. Ghias; Zhe Chen
venue: International Journal of Electrical Power & Energy Systems
citation: International Journal of Electrical Power & Energy Systems 155 (2024) 109641
notes: Open access (CC BY-NC-ND 4.0).

title: Explainable Graph Neural Networks for Power Grid Fault Detection
authors: Richard Bosso; Corey Chang; Mahdi Zarif; Yufei Tang
notes: Proposes an explainable GNN (EGNN) and an explanation evaluation framework for multi-class fault location using PMU voltage phasors on IEEE 34/123 and 342-node LVN feeders; does not study operational transition phases (islanding/restoration/reconnection).

title: Safe Reinforcement Learning-Based Resilient Proactive Scheduling for a Commercial Building Considering Correlated Demand Response
authors: Zheming Liang; Can Huang; Wencong Su; Nan Duan; Vaibhav Donde; Bin Wang; Xianbo Zhao
venue: IEEE Open Access Journal of Power and Energy
citation: IEEE Open Access Journal of Power and Energy 8 (2021)
notes: Commercial building / campus microgrid energy management for resilience under extreme weather; simulation-only validation with real-world datasets (San Jose campus parameters; PJM price; NREL irradiance/temperature cited).

title: Modularized Bilinear Koopman Operator for Modeling and Predicting Transients of Microgrids
authors: Xinyuan Jiang; Yan Li; Daning Huang
notes: Data-driven modular Koopman-bilinear surrogate (M-KBF) for transient prediction in inverter-dominated microgrids under disturbances.

title: Analytical Large-Signal Modeling of Inverter-based Microgrids with Koopman Operator Theory for Autonomous Control
authors: Zixiao Ma; Zhaoyu Wang
notes: Analytically derived Koopman-operator lifted linear model (EMT time-scale averaged dq model with primary + zero-control dynamics) used for secondary voltage restoration via LQI; validated in MATLAB simulations on a 3-DER 220 V microgrid test case (Figs. 3–8).

title: Structure-Preserving Model Order Reduction for Nonlinear DAE Models of Power Networks
authors: Muhammad Nadeem; Ahmad F. Taha
citation: IEEE Transactions on Power Systems (in press, Nov 2024); arXiv:2405.07587v2
notes: Structure-preserving MOR for nonlinear DAE models (SP-POD, SP-BPOD; DEIM for nonlinear-term hyper-reduction); not a transition-phase paper (no islanding/restoration/reconnection evaluation).

title: Feasibility Study of Neural ODE and DAE Modules for Power System Dynamic Component Modeling
authors: Tannan Xiao; Ying Chen; Shaowei Huang; Tirui He; Huizhe Guan
notes: Proposes neural ODE-E and neural DAE modules for data-driven dynamic component modeling and integrates learned models into transient stability simulation (IEEE-39 and modified 2383wp case studies); code: https://github.com/xxh0523/Py_PSNODE.

title: Distributed economic control strategy based on reinforcement pinning control for microgrids
authors: Shu Zheng; Zhi Wu; Lijuan Song; Wei Gu; Wei Liu; Jingtao Zhao; Zhihua Xu; Tao Hong
notes: Tabular reinforcement learning (Q-learning) sets pinning reference for marginal-cost consensus; PI secondary for frequency restoration; simulation in MATLAB/Simulink with islanding via opening PCC switch at t=0 s and control applied at t=1 s.

title: Curriculum-based deep evolutionary learning for large-scale grid look-ahead transient stability preventive dispatch
authors: Yixi Chen; Jizhong Zhu; Le Zhang; Yun Liu
notes: Look-ahead transient stability preventive dispatch solved via NES-based deep evolutionary learning; transient simulation via PSAT; dispatch interval 15 min.

title: Physics-Informed Learning Using Hamiltonian Neural Networks with Output Error Noise Models
authors: Sarvin Moradi; Nick Jaensson; Roland Tóth; Maarten Schoukens
notes: Method paper on physics-informed system identification using Hamiltonian neural networks with output-error noise models; not a power-system transition study.

title: Digital Twin-Driven Health Management in Microgrids
authors: Shayan Ebrahimi; Mohammad Seyedi; Kouhyar Sheida; Farzad Ferdowsi; Marc A. Carbone
notes: DC microgrid (solar PV + battery via bidirectional buck-boost converter) with Typhoon HIL 402 real-time digital twin; DT-driven health management and emergency mode transition support (Modes 0 & 4) plus AI (LSTM) fault detection/localization; not a grid reconnection/restoration/islanding transition study.

title: Event Classification in Active Distribution Grids Using Physics-Informed Graph Neural Network and PMU Measurements
authors: Mohammad MansourLakouraj; Mukesh Gautam; Rakib Hossain; Hanif Livani; Mohammed Benidris; Sesh Commuri
notes: Physics-informed spectral GCN for PMU-based event classification in DER-penetrated distribution feeders; evaluated on OpenDSS-simulated modified IEEE 34-bus with DERs; includes noise and missing-data tests.

title: Fast stability enhancement of inverter-based microgrids using NGO-LSTM algorithm
authors: Kai Pang; Zhiyuan Tang
notes: Inverter-based microgrid small-signal stability enhancement via local parameter adjustment using NGO-optimized LSTM.

title: An effective integrated optimal day-ahead and real-time power scheduling approach for hydrogen-based microgrid
authors: Pasquale Vizza; Stanislav Fedorov; Anna Pinnarelli; Vittorio Bilotta; Maria Elena Bruni
notes: Grids and Networks 44 (2025) 102039
column9: Hydrogen-based microgrid scheduling via integrated day-ahead and real-time optimization; dataset from Techfem S.p.A. (Fano, Italy) is confidential.

title: Optimal power scheduling in real-time distribution systems using crow search algorithm for enhanced microgrid performance
authors: Ganesh Selvaraj; Kanimozhi Rajangam; Pradeep Vishnuram; Mohit Bajaj; Ievgen Zaitsev
notes: ETAP-based AC-OPF load scheduling using Crow Search Algorithm; evaluated in grid-connected, islanded, and grid-connected with DG1 outage scenarios (TANGEDCO Kattur feeder, Ambikapuram substation ETAP model).

title: Physics-consistent machine learning with output projection onto physical manifolds
authors: Matilde Valente; Tiago C. Dias; Vasco Guerra; Rodrigo Ventura
notes: Not reported.

title: Coordinated Restoration Method for Electric Buses and Network Reconfigurations in Distribution Systems Under Extreme Events
authors: Bo Zhang; Lu Zhang; Wei Tang; Zhaoqi Wang; Chen Wang
venue: CSEE Journal of Power and Energy Systems
citation: CSEE Journal of Power and Energy Systems (2024)
notes: Post-disaster distribution-system service restoration coordinating network reconfiguration with mobile electric buses (V2G) using a bi-level optimization solved by PSO (upper) + GA (lower); transport congestion modeled via LOS/RDI; evaluated on a 5-feeder urban distribution system over a 6-hour restoration period.

title: Bi-level coordinated restoration for the distribution system and multi-microgrids
authors: Hao Zhu; Xiaotian Sun; Haipeng Xie; Lingfeng Tang; Zhaohong Bie
venue: International Journal of Electrical Power & Energy Systems
citation: International Journal of Electrical Power & Energy Systems (2025) 110371
notes: Bi-level MILP (with stochastic PV uncertainty) coordinating DSO repair crews, network reconfiguration, DG dispatch, and MGO autonomous DG/ESS dispatch; validated on IEEE 33-bus + three IEEE 13-node feeders.

title: Resilience driven EV coordination in multiple microgrids using distributed deep reinforcement learning
authors: Yuxin Wu; Ting Cai; Xiaoli Li
notes: Multi-microgrids resilience with EV routing + V2G scheduling for load restoration after upstream outage/line faults using distributed deep reinforcement learning.

title: Coordination of network reconfiguration and mobile energy storage system fleets to facilitate active distribution network restoration under forecast uncertainty
authors: Yundai Xu; Min Zhao; Han Wu; Sheng Xiang; Yue Yuan
notes: Active distribution network restoration with mobile energy storage (MESS) and network reconfiguration under load/PV forecast uncertainty; case study on a 59-bus rural distribution system in Jiangsu, China.

title: Resilient Scheduling of Networked Microgrids Against Real-Time Failures
authors: Hadi Safari Fesagandis; Mehdi Jalali; Kazem Zare; Mehdi Abapour; Hadis Karimipour
notes: Two-stage resilient scheduling (day-ahead grid-connected master plus real-time islanding subproblem) via Benders decomposition; evaluates multiple outage and microgrid-location scenarios; no ML method proposed.

title: A Framework for Coordinated Self-Assembly of Networked Microgrids Using Consensus Algorithms
authors: Schneider; Glass; Klauber; Ollis; Reno; Burck; Muhidin; Dubey; Du; Vu; Xie; Nordy; Dawson; Hernandez-Alvidrez; Bose; Ton; Yuan
notes: Distributed coordination framework for networked microgrid self-assembly using consensus algorithms and OpenFMB; targets supporting critical end-use loads during loss of the bulk power system (BPS).

title: A reconfiguration method of robust game for distribution-microgrid coordination considering battery aging cost
authors: Ruifeng Zhao; Kaiyan Pan; Jiangang Lu; Tianliang Gao; Yiquan Li; Youguo Zhao; Shangwei Liu
notes: Two-level Stackelberg (distribution network leader, microgrid follower) with distributionally robust optimization (KL-divergence ambiguity set) and improved K-means scenario clustering; validated on improved IEEE 69-bus with 3 microgrids over 24 h (1 h step).

title: Renewable microgrid optimization using AI: A B-SLR approach and future research directions
authors: Gaurav Sarin; Archi Srivastava; Ishi Srivastava; Saptarshi Bhattacharjee; Shreeya Gujaran; Y. Yogendra Sai Reddy
notes: Bibliometric–Systematic Literature Review (B-SLR) of 59 peer-reviewed studies (2014–2025) on AI in renewable microgrid optimization; no new ML method evaluated for power-system transition operations.

title: PIDGeuN: Graph Neural Network-Enabled Transient Dynamics Prediction of Networked Microgrids Through Full-Field Measurement
authors: Yin Yu; Xinyuan Jiang; Daning Huang; Yan Li; Meng Yue; Tianqiao Zhao
notes: Physics-informed dynamic GNN (PIDGeuN) for time-resolved transient dynamics prediction of a 33-bus networked microgrid using full-field measurable bus quantities; evaluated on synthetic electromechanical DAE simulations with load-step disturbances.

title: Research on Distributed Coordination Control Method for Microgrid System Based on Finite-time Event-triggered Consensus Algorithm
authors: Lizhen Wu; Heng Yang; Jianping Wei; Wenduwen(dong) Jiang
notes: Finite-time event-triggered consensus distributed secondary control for islanded microgrid voltage/frequency restoration and active power sharing; MATLAB/Simulink study (5×3 kW DG).

title: A Comprehensive Review of Control Strategies and Optimization Methods for Individual and Community Microgrids
authors: Navid Salehi; Herminio Martínez-García; Guillermo Velasco-Quesada; Josep M. Guerrero
notes: Review paper; discusses seamless transfer between grid-connected and islanded operation and surveys optimization/AI concepts for microgrids; no original transition-control ML method evaluation.

title: A review of intelligent control strategies for energy management systems in microgrids
authors: Mpho Sam Nkambule; Ali Nabil Hasan; Thokozani Shongwe
notes: Review of microgrid EMS architectures and control strategies (MPC, AI/ML incl. LSTM, RL, ANFIS, GAN, robust optimization, MAS, heuristics); includes cybersecurity and communication enablers; no original transition-control method evaluation.

title: An Adaptive Data-Driven-Based Control for Voltage Control Loop of Grid-Forming Converters in Variable Inertia MGs
authors: Watcharakorn Pinthurat; Prayad Kongsuk; Tossaporn Surinkaew; Boonruang Marungsri
notes: Adaptive data-driven voltage-loop control for grid-forming converters in variable-inertia microgrids using moving-window subspace state-space identification (4SID) and online controller update; validated in MATLAB/Simulink average-model simulations with islanding and fault scenarios.

title: Physics informed ANN model for identifying physical and cyber anomalies in centralized load sharing controller in AC microgrids
authors: Arti Singhal; Ashu Verma; Rabindra Mohanty
notes: ANN-based anomaly/event classifier for distinguishing cyber-attacks vs physical events using ROCOF/ROCOV in grid-connected AC microgrids with centralized load sharing; evaluated in MATLAB/Simulink and validated on OPAL-RT + C2000.

title: Single-inductor multiple-output converter for hydrogen electrolyzer arrays in PV-HESS-PEM microgrid using deep neural network based model predictive control
authors: Binbin Xun; Xinqiang Tang; Qing Fu; Benfei Wang
notes: Not reported.

title: A review of control strategies for optimized microgrid operations
authors: Shaibu Ali Juma; Sarah Paul Ayeng’o; Cuthbert Z. M. Kimambo
notes: Scoping review of microgrid control strategies and architectures; discusses AI and optimization for energy management; not an original ML transition-control evaluation.

title: Physics-Informed Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks for Power System Dynamics
authors: Hang Shuai; Fangxing Li
venue: IEEE Open Access Journal of Power and Energy
citation: IEEE Open Access Journal of Power and Energy (2025)
notes: Introduces Physics-Informed Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (PIKANs) for learning rotor angle/frequency dynamics and identifying inertia/damping; evaluated on SMIB

title: Active Learning of Microgrid Frequency Dynamics Using Neural Ordinary Differential Equations
authors: Tara Aryal; Pooja Aslami; Niranjan Bhujel; Hossein Moradi Rekabdarkolaee; Kaiqun Fu; Zongjie Wang; Timothy M. Hansen
notes: Model-free neural ODE with explicit input-dynamics network; training via active excitation using ESS-injected signals and transfer learning for topology/dispatch adaptation; benchmarked on Cordova, Alaska microgrid model (MATLAB/Simulink) and includes OPAL-RT timing test; code: https://github.com/TaraAryal/Neural_ODE_for_Complex_System.

title: Simulation of a closed-loop dc-dc converter using a physics-informed neural network-based model
authors: Marc-Antoine Coulombe; Maxime Berger; Antoine Lesage-Landry
notes: Power-electronics (dc-dc boost converter) time-domain surrogate simulation study; not a power-system transition (islanding/restoration/reconnection) evaluation.

title: Challenges of operating multiple distributed generators with different primary control strategies in microgrids: Interactions and performance assessment
authors: Allal El Moubarek Bouzid; Corinne Alonso; Gerard Beral
notes: Standalone single-phase AC microgrid benchmarking heterogeneous primary droop-based controllers (CDC, UDC, dVOC, VSG) using Typhoon HIL 604 real-time simulation; focuses on islanded power-sharing performance under load variations, impedance mismatches, and plug-and-play DER events.

title: Resilient dynamic microgrid formation by deep reinforcement learning integrating physics-informed neural networks
authors: Mingze Xu; Shunbo Lei; Chong Wang; Liang Liang; Junhua Zhao; Chaoyi Peng
notes: DDPG-based DRL for sequential load restoration and dynamic microgrid formation under cold load pickup (CLPU) uncertainty; validated on modified IEEE 123-node and IEEE 8500-node feeders using OpenDSS power-flow simulation; compares PPO/TD3/DDPG.

title: Physics-Informed Neural Networks for Power Systems Warm-Start Optimization
authors: Àlex Tudoras-Miravet; Esteban González-Iakl; Oriol Gomis-Bellmunt; Eduardo Prieto-Araujo
notes: Warm-start AC-OPF using PINNs; steady-state optimization focus (not a grid transition phase study).

title: Differentiable predictive control: Deep learning alternative to explicit model predictive control for unknown nonlinear systems
authors: Ján Drgoňa; Karol Kiš; Aaron Tuor; Draguna Vrabie; Martin Klaučo
notes: Differentiable predictive control (DPC) as deep-learning alternative to explicit MPC; demonstrated on FlexyAir laboratory SISO floater-position control with embedded Raspberry Pi implementation; out of scope for power-system transition studies.

title: Physics-consistent machine learning with output projection onto physical manifolds
authors: Matilde Valente; Tiago C. Dias; Vasco Guerra; Rodrigo Ventura
notes: Post-training constrained optimization projects ML outputs onto manifolds defined by physical laws; demonstrations include spring–mass energy conservation and low-temperature oxygen plasma constraints with reduced RMSE and constraint violations; not a power-system transition study.

title: Operation optimisation of direct current microgrids toward stability and economy: a model-data co-driven framework
authors: Yuxin Zhu; Fei Wang; Zhengyu Lin; James Fleming
notes: Stability-constrained operation optimization (SCOO) for islanded DC microgrids using DNN surrogate indicator function plus model-based compensation; includes N-1 DER unplug contingencies and public code/data links (Zenodo/Figshare mentioned in paper metadata).

title: Prediction-Free Coordinated Dispatch of Microgrid: A Data-Driven Online Optimization Approach
authors: Kaidi Huang; Lin Cheng; Ning Qi; David Wenzhong Gao; Asad Mujeeb; Qinglai Guo
notes: Prediction-free, data-driven online optimization for coordinated microgrid dispatch (details not reported in provided snippet).

title: Safe and Stable Secondary Voltage Control of Microgrids Based on Explicit Neural Networks
authors: Zixiao Ma; Qianzhi Zhang; Zhaoyu Wang
notes: Explicit neural-network secondary voltage controller for islanded inverter-based microgrids with transient safety bounds and Lyapunov stability constraints enforced during offline training; validated via time-domain simulation on a 3-DER 220 V prototype microgrid.

title: Machine learning with data assimilation and uncertainty quantification for dynamical systems: a review
authors: Sibo Cheng; Cesar Quilodrán-Casas; Said Ouala; Alban Farchi; Che Liu; Pierre Tandeo; Ronan Fablet; Didier Lucor; Bertrand Iooss; Julien Brajard; Dunhui Xiao; Tijana Janjic; Weiping Ding; Yike Guo; Alberto Carrassi; Marc Bocquet; Rossella Arcucci
notes: Survey of machine learning combined with data assimilation and uncertainty quantification for dynamical systems (geoscience/CFD and related domains); not a power-system transition study.

title: Physics-informed reinforcement learning for probabilistic wind power forecasting under extreme events
authors: Yanli Liu; Junyi Wang; Liqi Liu
notes: Probabilistic (quantile) wind power forecasting under extreme cold wave (Jan 4–9, 2021) using physics-informed DDPG with abrupt-feature indices and pinball-loss reward; 15-minute data from six wind farms in Ji Bei, China; data/code not released.

title: Physics-Informed Neural Network-Based Control for Grid-Forming Converter’s Stability Under Overload Conditions
authors: Abhay Kumar; Dushyant Sharma; Mayukha Pal
notes: PINN-augmented droop-based grid-forming converter control under overload with DC source saturation and AC current limiting; evaluated in Simulink on a modified IEEE 13-bus microgrid.

title: Physics-informed transient stability assessment of microgrids
authors: Priyanka Mishra; Peng Zhang
notes: PINN learns a Lyapunov function for transient stability assessment of VSC-interfaced microgrids; validated against time-domain simulation under fault, droop-coefficient change, and switch-opening-based source/load disconnection plus load shedding.

title: Cyber-physical security for microgrids through Digital Twin technologies: A review and research outlook
authors: Bushra Canaan; Yosra Makhlouf; Djaffar Ould Abdeslam
notes: Security-focused review of Microgrid Digital Twins (MGDTs) including development frameworks
column11: and attack/defense mechanisms (tables summarize prior testbeds).

title: Artificial intelligence for microgrids design, control, and maintenance: A comprehensive review and prospects
authors: Mojtaba Hadi; Elhoussin Elbouchikhi; Zhibin Zhou; Abdelhakim Saim; Miadreza Shafie-khah; Pierluigi Siano; Hesam Rahbarimagham; Pau Marti Colom
notes: Notes: comprehensive review of AI for microgrid design, hierarchical control, and maintenance; not a primary transition-method evaluation study.

title: Applications of Physics-Informed Neural Networks in Power Systems - A Review
authors: Bin Huang; Jianhui Wang
notes: Survey of physics-informed neural network paradigms and applications in power systems; does not present original ML method evaluation for islanding/restoration/reconnection transition phases.

title: LOBSTER (LOss-Based SensiTivity rEgulaRization): Towards deep sparse neural networks
authors: Enzo Tartaglione; Andrea Bragagnolo; Attilio Fiandrotti; Marco Grangetto
notes: Loss-gradient sensitivity regularization and prune-from-scratch training for sparse deep neural networks; not a power-system transition study.

title: Uniform Physics Informed Neural Network Framework for Microgrid and Its Application in Voltage Stability Analysis
authors: Renhai Feng; Khan Wajid; Muhammad Faheem; Jiang Wang; Fazal E. Subhan; Muhammad Shoaib Bhutta
notes: Uniform Physics-Informed Neural Network (UPINN) with PPO-based RL, GRU gating, and transfer/feedback operators for PV/wind/ESS parameter extraction and voltage-stability monitoring; no islanding/restoration/reconnection transition evaluation reported.

title: Inverter PQ Control with Trajectory Tracking Capability for Microgrids Based on Physics-informed Reinforcement Learning
authors: Buxin She; Fangxing Li; Hantao Cui; Hang Shuai; Oroghene Oboreh-Snapps; Rui Bo; Nattapat Praisuwanna; Jingxin Wang; Leon M. Tolbert
notes: Adaptive time-varying PI gains learned by physics-informed TD3 RL for inverter PQ control with trajectory tracking; validated in MATLAB/Simulink and power HIL at CURENT HTB.

title: Modified hard-constrained PINNs for physically consistent microgrid transient response modeling
authors: Likun Chen; Yifan Wang; Wei Sun; Lei Shang; Xuzhu Dong; Bo Wang
venue: International Journal of Electrical Power & Energy Systems
citation: International Journal of Electrical Power & Energy Systems 169 (2025) 110726
notes: Hard-constrained PINNs for microgrid transient response modeling; RTDS control-hardware-in-loop (CHIL) validation; code available (Apache-2.0) on GitHub; data available on request.

title: Machine learning-based energy management and power forecasting in grid-connected microgrids with multiple distributed energy sources
authors: Arvind R. Singh; R. Seshu Kumar; Mohit Bajaj; Chetan B. Khadse; Ievgen Zaitsev
notes: SVR-based forecasting plus day-ahead microgrid EMS scheduling in a grid-connected test system; simulation study.
